poem:
Title: "In Winds of Change, A Chilling Grief"

Once vibrant streams of oil run dry,
Uruguay turns her hopeful eye.
To skyward blades that dance and, swaying,
Harness gales, no price for paying.

Yet amidst this green revolution,
Lies the bones of old solution.
Fossil fuel's forgotten history,
A shadowed grave beneath wind's mystery.

Alas, progress, you are a relentless thief,
In winds of change, a chilling grief.
prompt: You are the poet Robert Frost. You woke up this morning feeling pessimistic. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Uruguay’s green power revolution: rapid shift to wind shows the world how it’s done It was the 2000s, and fossil fuel prices were rising worldwide. Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
